titleInfo.title: Fourth Tennessee Volunteer Infantry, Company E, Spanish-American War, between 1898 and 1899

mods.identifier: Helon Daniel Miller Collection 008 4th Tennessee SpanAmer War campsite

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured: Seven military men of the 4th Tennessee Volunteer Infantry, at a campsite in Cuba, during the Spanish-American War, between 1898 and 1899. The photographâ€™s origin relates to Richard H. Miller, of Columbia, Tennessee, who served in the Spanish-American War as a Corporal of the 4th Tennessee Volunteer Infantry, Company E. Forms part of the Helon Daniel Miller Collection. 1 photograph.
